entry.title: Travel spending dips in Douglas County
entry.summary: Sept. 24, 2025 11:55 a.m. Travel spending in Douglas County saw a small decrease in 2024 compared to the previous year, according to a recent study done by research firm Dean Runyan Associates. The firm reports that travelers spent $316.2 million in Douglas County in 2024, down almost $3 million from the same period in...

entry.title: Roseburg City Council passes on property for homeless
entry.summary: Sept. 24, 2025 11:50 a.m. The Roseburg City Council has withdrawn its support for an urban campground at a vacant lot on Southeast Stephens. Council members voted 6-2 to cancel the purchase of the old Reddaway trucking depot at their meeting Monday, according to The News-Review. entry.title: Roseburg City Council Rejects Campground Site, Releases Report, and Declines Fireworks Ban
entry.summary: Roseburg City Council voted 6-2 to cancel purchase of the Stephens St. site for a proposed urban campground, unanimously agreed to release the full Rummel investigation report, and rejected a citywide fireworks ban by a 6-2 vote. The next meeting is set for Oct. 13 at City Hall.

entry.title: Holly O'Dell recognized as Southern Region Juvenile Justice Professional of the Year
entry.summary: Working in juvenile justice is something of a balancing act. It requires both the strength to make youth take responsibility for their actions and the drive to promote their growth as citizens.

entry.title: Roseburg Man Dies in Single-Vehicle Crash Near Dillard
entry.summary: A 65-year-old Roseburg man, David Knott, died Monday evening after a single-vehicle crash on Old Highway 99 South near Dillard. His vehicle left the road and bystanders attempted CPR, but he was pronounced dead at the scene. The crash remains under investigation.

entry.title: DFPA Raises Fire Danger Level to High Starting Sept. 23
entry.summary: DFPA will raise fire danger to HIGH on Sept. 23. Public Use Restrictions increase: power saws, mowing cured grass, welding, and metal cutting are only allowed before 10 a.m. or after 8 p.m. Industrial Fire Precaution Level remains at IFPL II.

entry.title: Roseburg Fire Department to Issue Residential Burn Permits in October
entry.summary: Roseburg Fire Department will issue residential burn permits Oct. 1–31. Permits cost $75, valid for 7 days, and allow yard waste only. Fires must be attended, out before dark, and burn barrels are banned. Apply weekdays at 541-492-6770 or online at cityofroseburg.org/departments/fire/burn-permits.

entry.title: Roseburg City Council to Consider Fireworks Ban, Urban Campground Proposal
